page.title: 17DOULTING STONE.(ONE)
page.content: {Doulting Stone}has been quarried in and around{Doulting}since at least 709 A.D. We know this because the monks who built and owned{Glastonbury {Abbey}allowed some people to dig some Doulting Stone to re-build the wooden church in Doulting after{St. Aldhelm had died there. There have been a lot of{quarries}around{Doulting}and those which were a long way from the railway line had a tramway connecting them to a mason's shed next to the{Great {Western Railway}near Merrifield Lane. The tramway which connected the quarries in{Doulting}and{Chelynch}was taken up when the{Bath and Portland {Stone Company}bought them. The lines are still underneath the Frome to Shepton Mallet road. Nowadays lorries are used to take the stone away to be used in building.
